title: Regjstered nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Howard County Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Easy! Interviewed, shadowed, was offered a few days later. This was a few yrs ago and management has changed since. Great place to work! Pay tends to be on lower end though so that’s the downside
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions that you can expect

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Howard County Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Look for positions online or through the website. Fill out online job application, contacted by HR, set up interview with manager. It was a pretty straightforward process without anything unexpected.
Interview Questions: Questions about past experience relevant to the role.

title: New Grad Nurse Residency Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Howard County Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: It was easy and straight to the point. They asked about a time you had a conflict at work and how it was resolved. Also asked about my strength and weaknesses.
Interview Questions: what are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Howard County Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Great, loved the former manager and their empathy and approachable demeanor. I felt at ease around them. Felt there was genuine interest in me joining the team. Good interview. Not sure what else to add.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at this institution and on this unit?

title: Student Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Howard County Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was an overall good experience, Online due to Covid. Pannel of 2 people that rotated asking questions. I got a call/ email a week or two later with the job offer.
Interview Questions: Scenario questions: what would you do when/if...

title: ER Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Howard County Medical Center in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Great process!! A+ I enjoyed the process and the people that conducted the interview. I would interview with them again if I got the chance. Love this hospital group. I would recommend to anyone else
Interview Questions: previous experience, specifically what hospitals floors and hours worked

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Howard County Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Submitted online and had a phone interview. Very generic interview but they called me back twice for clarifying questions. No in person interview due to COVID. Pay is insanely low for the area so I declined

title: New Grad Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Howard County Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Not too bad, several questions regarding "what would you do" given the situation. Only 25 minutes long. They rushed a little bit towards the end, did not get to ask all of my questions.
Interview Questions: How to deal with a difficult family member.

title: Patient Clerical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Howard County Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Initial brief phone call for background information about role. I came in to interview with HR and unit manager. HR department seemed to be organized and professional. You'll interview directly on the unit if the supervisor has an office there.  Called by HR for offer.
Interview Questions: General behavior questions...Describe a time you overcame a challenge? How do you handle conflict or angry customers?

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Howard County Medical Center (Columbia, MD)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and the recruiter reached out for an interview about five days later and I had my interview 2 days after.  I waited about 3 weeks to hear back.
Interview Questions: What frustrates you the most at work?

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Howard County Medical Center (Columbia, MD) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied on line and it took about a month for them to call me for interview . The interview took like 30min And they ask about my experience in my previous job. Told me about their policy
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to work there

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Howard County Medical Center (Columbia, MD) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: They called me for an interview then afterwards they asked me to set up a day to come in for a 2 hour shadow day to watch and see if i like the job
Interview Questions: How would i deal with a difficult situation

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Howard County Medical Center (Columbia, MD) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Its a very lengthy process BUT ONLY IF you pass the first interview which involves a test. 
Once greeted you are prompted to do a test before going into the interview if you pass the test then you go into the interview. the one with HR is simple just questions about yourself and as to why you'd be a good fit for the organization. then if you pass you'll go on to the unit where you meet the managers and they interview you. If you pass then you do a shadow day.
Interview Questions: Wh are you a good fit?, Clinical questions regarding patient care (think carefully)

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Johns Hopkins Howard County Medical Center (Baltimore, MD) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions: Application submit online, interview with department in person.
